solution.text:
The Lattice Enthalpy \((\Delta _ {lattice} H)\) = \(\Delta _a H + \Delta _i H + \frac{1}{2}\Delta _ {bond} H + \Delta _ {eg} H - \Delta _f H\)
Note: The bond enthalpy is divided by 2 because the formation reaction is \(Ag + \frac{1}{2} Cl_2 \rightarrow AgCl\)\(\implies \Delta _ {lattice} H = _{j}_ + _{k}_ + _{l}_ + (-_{m}_) - (-_{n}_)\)
\(\implies \Delta _ {lattice} H = _{{j + k + l - m + n}}_\)

content.text:
Calculate the Lattice Enthalpy for the formation of Silver Chloride under non-standard conditions \((Ag + \frac{1}{2}Cl_2 \rightarrow AgCl)\) given the following data:
  • \(\Delta _a H\) (Atomization) of \(Ag (s) = _{j}_ \frac{kJ}{mol}\)
  • \(\Delta _i H\) (Ionization) of \(Ag (s) = _{k}_ \frac{kJ}{mol}\)
  • \(\Delta _ {bond} H\) (Bond) of \(Cl_2 (g) = _{{2*l}}_ \frac{kJ}{mol}\)
  • \(\Delta _ {eg} H\) (Electron Gain) of \(Cl (g) = -_{m}_ \frac{kJ}{mol}\)
  • \(\Delta _fH\)(Formation) of \(AgCl (s) = -_{n}_ \frac{kJ}{mol}\)
